title: Self-Portrait

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of pastel on gray wove paper, with blue and black fibrous inclusions.

medium_display: Pastel on gray wove paper, with blue and black fibrous inclusions
inscriptions: Signed and dedicated recto, lower center, in yellow pastel: "a Lugné-Poe/affettuosamente/-G. Severini MCMIX"
publication_history:
Maria Drudi Gambillo and Teresa Fiori, Archivi del Futurismo II (Rome, 1962), p. 337, fig. 2.

Joshua C. Taylor, “Gino Severini: A Self Portrait,” Museum Studies 2 (1967), p. 56, fig. 4.

Filiberto Menna, Gino Severini: La vita di un pittore (Milan, 1983), n.p., fig. 4.

Piero Pacini, Gli Autoritratti di Gino Severini (Cortona, 1986), n.p., fig. 4.

Daniela Fonti, Gino Severini: Catalogo ragionato (Milan, 1988), p. 96 (ill.), cat. 81.

The Art Institute of Chicago, Graphic Modernism : Selections from the Francey and Dr. Martin L. Gecht Collection at the Art Institute of Chicago, exh. cat. (Chicago, 2003), pp. x, xi and 179, fig. 4.

Sandy Brooke, Drawing as Expression, Techniques and Concepts, 2nd ed. (Prentice Hall, Oregon State University, 2006).
exhibition_history:
Rome, Palazzo Venezia, "Mostra Antologica di Gino Severini: Premio Nazionale delle Arti del Ministero della Pubblica Istruzione per l’anno 1960," May 13–June 4, 1961, p. 47, pl. IV, cat. 7.

Rotterdam, Museum Boymans-van Beuningen, "Gino Severini," June 28–September 1, 1963, n.p., cat. 7 (ill.).

Paris, Musée National d’Art Moderne, "Gino Severini," July–October, 1967, p. 30, cat. 117. 

New York, Wildenstein and Company, "Modern Portraits: The Self and Others," October 20–November 28, 1976, pp. 149 and 150 (ill.).

Cortina d’Ampezzo, Galleria d’arte moderna Farsetti, "Gino Severini, Opere dal 1907 al 1959: centenario della nascita dell artista (Cortona 1883–Parigi 1966)," December 26, 1982–January 9, 1983, n.p. (ill.); traveled to Milan, Galleria d’arte moderna Farsetti, January 15, 1983–February 15, 1983.

Florence, Pitti Palace, "Gino Severini (1883–1966)," June 25–September 25, 1983, pp. 67 (ill.), 163, and 164, cat. 13.
provenance_text: Given by the artist to Aurelian-François Lugne-Poe [inscription]; by descent to Mme. Lugne-Poe; sold, Hôtel Drouot, Paris, June 22, 1945, Lugne-Poe sale, lot 57.  Mme. René Donath, Paris [according to Rome 1961].  Sold by B. C. Holland Gallery, Chicago, to the Art Institute, 1969.
